title: Strictly Come Dancing results backlash as Catherine Tyldesley voted off
text:
Catherine Tyldesley was eliminated from Strictly Come Dancing (Picture: BBC)

Strictly Come Dancing fans are up in arms following the news that Catherine Tyldesley is the fifth star to be eliminated from the series.

The Coronation Street actress and her partner Johannes Radebe were kicked off the show after competing against Mike Bushell and Katya Jones in the dance-off.

Craig Revel Horwood chose to save Mike and Katya, while Motsi Mabuse and Bruno Tonioli opted for Catherine and Johannes, but it was Shirley Ballas who had the deciding vote and chose the former.

When asked about her time on the show, Catherine said: ‘Him [Johannes], yeah, he’s like my best friend.

‘He’s just…oooh, (referring to eye make-up) it’s waterproof…just the opportunity to work with amazing people and get critiqued off amazing people.

‘I never thought I’d say this, I’m going to keep it up because I fell in love with it! I’ve loved every second, this man has changed my life.’

Catherine and Johannes were up against Mike and Katya (Picture: BBC)

Viewers were seething at the panelists’ decision though and raged at Catherine’s exit news on Twitter, with one writing: ‘What on earth has happened – ridiculous decision – is it because he works for the BBC?’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Echoing a similar sentiment, another added: ‘Terrible decision by the judges there. Wrong couple voted off for me.’

Strictly Come Dancing fans aren’t happy with the results of tonight’s elimination

Terrible decision by the judges there. Wrong couple voted off for me. #Strictly — Richard Thomas (@RickyThomasblog) October 27, 2019

Wrong decision again, she was under marked on the night #strictly — Alice (@ARLaffar) October 27, 2019

Oh quite shocked at the #Strictly result tonight. Thought Shirley was building up to save Cath there. Bit gutted — Lyndyloo 🎃🕷🎃 (@LyndaMiddleton) October 27, 2019

What on earth has happened – ridiculous decision – is it because he works for the BBC? #strictly — Alyssa Upton (@alyssa_upton) October 27, 2019

Well I didn’t agree with that! #strictly — Rhodri Lewis (@rhodrilewis5) October 27, 2019

Wrong decision. And my timeline appears to be unanimous on this. This year’s series is not improving. #Strictly — Annette Hardy (@Annette1Hardy) October 27, 2019

They’re the fifth couple to be eliminated (Picture: BBC)

This isn’t the first time fans have raged over the results from this series.

Earlier this month, viewers kicked off when radio presenter Dev Griffin was booted from the competition.

Head judge Shirley Ballas admitted that she was on the receiving end of death threats after sending Dev home.

Talking on The Zoe Ball Breakfast Show, she said: ‘[Dev’s] marks weren’t low, they were in the middle of the pack, and at the end of the day, you can only go on the dance that is put in front of you.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Not past performance, not what you think he is capable of.’

One member of the Strictly cast to have spoken out in Shirley’s defense is pro dancer AJ Pritchard, who has begged fans to focus on positivity rather than sending abuse to the judges.

‘There is no excuse for the trolling and death threats. All the abuse they have been getting is not right,’ the 24-year-old said.

Strictly Come Dancing returns Saturday at 7pm on BBC One.

Oh my god. Not only have we lost Cath, WE HAVE LOST JOHANNES. WHAT THE ACTUAL F #Strictly — The Eloquent Parrot (@EloquentParrot) October 27, 2019
description: Strictly Come Dancing backlash as Catherine Tyldesley is eliminated from series.
